Detailed Description

Object to store information about arbitrary cell wise calibration of the HCAL in LC Objects.

Author:
S. Schmidt DESY
Date:
Jul 2006

virtual float CALICE::LCHcalCalibrationObject::applyCalibrationError ( float  inputValue,
float  inputError 
) const [inline, virtual]

let the object calculate the error after applying the calibration stored in the object

Parameters:
inputValue "energy" value of the cell stored before the calibration
inputError error of the "energy" value of the cell before the calibration
Returns:
error of the "energy" value of the cell after the calibration taking into account the error of the "energy" value of the cell before the calibration and the error of the calibration itself

Reimplemented in CALICE::DeadNoiseConstants, CALICE::GainConstants, CALICE::InterConstants, CALICE::LCHcalCalibrationObject2D, CALICE::MIPConstants, CALICE::PedestalConstants, CALICE::TcmtSaturationConstants, and CALICE::TempGainConstants.

is the calibration stored in the object valid?

Returns:
true if the calibration is valid, false if no valid calibration is available
